body:
Thanks for the repro. This bug is specific to `new_local_repository`, since the `build_file` attribute is actually of type `str` rather than `Label` (see [docs](https://bazel.build/reference/be/workspace#new_local_repository.build_file)). This, in turn, seems to be in order to support a legacy use case where a path (instead of a label) could be used for this attribute (see [code](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/rules/repository/NewRepositoryFileHandler.java;drc=08463dcc09d65fa8fea64b1411be9b0c3941186e;l=219)). This is otherwise fine, but in case a label is used, it's treated as a canonical label, forgoing repo mapping altogether (see [code](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/rules/repository/NewRepositoryFileHandler.java;drc=08463dcc09d65fa8fea64b1411be9b0c3941186e;l=185)).

The proper fix would be to change the attribute type to a label, which is potentially backwards-incompatible but well, we are allowed to do that.

issue.title: [7.0.0] Unable to load workspace "@myworkspace" where `new_local_repository.build_file` refers to BUILD file w/ label "@myworkspace//path/to:BUILD.bazel"

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.title: Make the attr `new_local_repository.build_file` label-typed

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The attribute is string-typed to support a legacy use case where a path instead of a label could be passed. This causes us to parse a passed label as a canonical label, forgoing repo mapping altogether.

Fixes #19963.

RELNOTES[INC]: The attribute `new_local_repository.build_file` no longer accepts a path; a label must be passed instead.

issue.body:
The attribute is string-typed to support a legacy use case where a path instead of a label could be passed. This causes us to parse a passed label as a canonical label, forgoing repo mapping altogether.

Fixes #19963.

RELNOTES[INC]: The attribute `new_local_repository.build_file` no longer accepts a path; a label must be passed instead.

Closes #19992.

body: A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 7.0.0 RC5](https://releases.bazel.build/7.0.0/rc5/index.html). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible. Thanks!
